The DNN_likelihood object¶

Summary¶

Bla bla bla

Usage¶

Class¶

class DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood(name=None, data=None, input_data_file=None, load_on_RAM=False, seed=None, dtype=None, same_data=True, model_data_inputs=None, model_define_inputs=None, model_optimizer_inputs=None, model_compile_inputs=None, model_callbacks_inputs=None, model_train_inputs=None, resources_inputs=None, output_folder=None, ensemble_name=None, input_summary_json_file=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

Arguments¶

name¶

Name of the DNN_likelihood object. It is used to build the DNN_likelihood.name attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

data¶

Input Data object. Either this or the input_data_file input argument should be provided to initialize a DNN_likelihood object and to set the DNN_likelihood.data attribute.

  • type: Data object or None

  • default: None

input_data_file¶

File name (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute, with or without any of the .json or .h5 extensions) of a saved Data object. Either this or the data input argument should be provided to initialize a DNN_likelihood objectand to set the DNN_likelihood.data attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

load_on_RAM¶

If True all data available in the dataset corresponding to the input_data_file input are loaded into the RAM for faster generation of train/validation/test data. If False the HDF5 dataset file is open in read mode and train/validation/test data are generated on demand. It is used to build the DNN_likelihood.load_on_RAM attribute.

  • type: bool

  • default: False

seed¶

Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy and tensorflow random state. It is used to ste the DNN_likelihood.seed attribute.

  • type: int or None

  • default: None

dtype¶

It represents the data type into which train/val/test data are converted. It is used to ste the DNN_likelihood.dtype attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

same_data¶

This option is passed to the DNN_likelihood object by the DNN_likelihood_ensemble object to specify if the same train/val data are used for the different DNN_likelihoods in the ensemble or not. In this way DNN_likelihood object knows how to deal with the corresponding Data object to generate train/val data. It is used to ste the DNN_likelihood.same_data attribute.

  • type: bool

  • default: True

model_data_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to data. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_data_inputs.

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “npoints” (value type: list, shape: [n_train, n_val, n_test])

      List with number of train, validation, and test points. The validation and test entries could also be passed in the form of fractions (<=1) of n_train. These will be automatically converted in absolute numbers.

    • “scalerX” (value type: bool)

      If True X input points are scaled with a StandardScaler fit to the train data. If not given it is automatically set to False.

    • “scalerY” (value type: bool)

      If True Y input points are scaled with a StandardScaler fit to the train data. If not given it is automatically set to False.

    • “weighted” (value type: bool)

      If True X input points are weighted (see the DNN_likelihood.compute_sample_weights method). If not given it is automatically set to False.

  • example:

    model_data_inputs = {"npoints": [n_train, n_val, n_test],
                     "scalerX": True,
                     "scalerY": True,
                     "weighted": False}

  • default: None

model_define_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model specifications, including the structure of hidden layers with their activation functions and kerner initializers, activation functions in the output layer, Dropout rate, and batch normalization. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_define_inputs. The activation functions and the kerner initializers in each layer are specified together with the number of nodes in the layer (see the example below). All tf.keras specifications for the activation functions and kerner initializers are supported. In the case of selu activation the lecun_normal initializer is automatically used and possible Dropout layers are replaced by AlphaDropout ones. In case of activation functions other than selu, if no kerner initializers is specified, then the default one is used.

  • type: None or dict with the following structure

    • “hidden_layers” (value type: list, shape: [[int,str,str],...,[int,str,str]])

      List with hidden layers specifications. Each hidden layer is represented by a list with number of nodes (int), activation function (str), and (optionally) initializer (str).

    • “act_func_out_layer” (value type: str)

      Activation function for the output layer. If not specified it is automatically set to "linear".

    • “dropout_rate” (value type: float)

      If different than 0, then Dropout layers with the given dropout_rate are added between each pair of hidden layers. If not specified it is automatically set to 0.

    • “batch_norm” (value type: bool)

      If True, then batch normalization layers are added after the input layer and between each pair of hidden layers. If not specified it is automatically set to False.

  • example:

    model_define_inputs = {"hidden_layers": [[300, "selu"],
                                         [300, "relu"],
                                         [300, "selu", "lecun_normal"],
                                         [300, "relu", "glorot_uniform"]],
                       "act_func_out_layer": "linear",
                       "dropout_rate": 0,
                       "batch_norm": True}

  • default: None

model_optimizer_inputs¶

String or dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.optimizers specifications. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_optimizer_inputs. It could be specified either as a string with the name of the optimizer (all default parameters will be used in this case) or as a dictionary with one item of the form "name": "optimizer_name" and all other items specifying parameters related to that optimizer in the form "parameter": value (see the example below). All unspecified parameters are set to their default value.

  • type: str or None or dict with the following structure:

    • “name” (value type: str)

      Name of the optimizer.

    • others

      All input arguments accepted by the corresponding tf.keras.optimizers. For all unspecified inputs default values will be used.

  • example:

    model_optimizer_inputs = {"name": "Adam",
                          "lr": 0.001,
                          "beta_1": 0.9,
                          "beta_2": 0.999,
                          "amsgrad": False}

  • default: None

model_compile_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model.compile specifications, including loss and metrics. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_compile_inputs. Both the short name and the true name of a metrix are allowed (for instance, both "mse" and "mean_squared_error" are allowed).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “loss” (value type: str)

      Name of the loss (either abbreviated or extended). If not specified the user is warned that it will be automatically set to "mse".

    • “metrics” (value type: list)

      List with the name (either abbreviated or extended) of the metrics to be monitored. If not specified it will be automatically set to ["mse","mae","mape","msle"]

  • example:

    model_compile_inputs = {"loss": "mse",
                        "metrics": ["mean_squared_error", "mae", "msle"]}

  • default: None

model_callbacks_inputs¶

List of strings and/or dictionaries specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.callbacks specifications. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_callbacks_inputs. Each item in the list could be specified either as a string with the name of the callback (all default parameters will be used in this case) or as a dictionary with one item of the form "name": "callback_name" and all other items specifying parameters related to that callback in the form "parameter": value (see the example below). All unspecified parameters are set to their default value. All tf.keras.callbacks are available, together with the "PlotLossesKeras" callback from the livelossplot package. Arguments specifying output files/folders for callbacks writing to files, that are "PlotLossesKeras", "ModelCheckpoint", and "TensorBoard", are automatically set and the related inputs are ignored.

  • type: list or None

  • list items type: str and/or dict with the following structure

    • “name” (value type: str)

      Name of the callback.

    • others

      All input arguments accepted by the corresponding tf.keras.callbacks. For all unspecified inputs default values will be used.

  • example:

    model_callbacks_inputs = [{"name": "EarlyStopping",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "patience": 100,
                           "min_delta": 0.0001,
                           "restore_best_weights": True},
                          "TerminateOnNaN",
                          "PlotLossesKeras",
                          {"name": "ReduceLROnPlateau",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "factor": 0.2,
                           "min_lr": 0.00008,
                           "patience": 10,
                           "min_delta": 0.0001},
                          {"name": "ModelCheckpoint",
                           "filepath": "this is ignored and automatically set",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "save_best_only": True,
                           "save_freq": "epoch"}]

  • default: None

model_train_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model.fit specifications, including number of epochs and batch size. It is used to set the private attribute DNN_likelihood.__model_train_inputs. Both the short name and the true name of a metrix are allowed (for instance, both "mse" and "mean_squared_error" are allowed).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “epochs” (value type: int)

      Number of epochs to run.

    • “batch_size” (value type: int)

      Batch size to use in training, evaluation, and prediction.

  • example:

    model_train_inputs={"epochs": 300,
                    "batch_size": 512}

  • default: None

resources_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying available resources. This input argument is assumed to be specified automatically when the DNN_likelihood object is created from within the DNN_likelihood_ensemble one in order to sync resources between the different DNN_likelihoods (see the DNN_likelihood_ensemble object).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “available_gpus” (value type: list, shape: (n_gpus,2))

      List of lists with device ID and information of the available GPUs.

    • “available_cpu” (value type: list, shape: (3,))

      List with device ID, specifications, number of cores of the available CPU.

    • “active_gpus” (value type: list, shape: (n_active_gpus,2))

      List of lists with device ID and information of the subset of available GPUs that are active in the current environment.

    • “gpu_mode” (value type: bool)

      True if the current machine has available GPUs, False otherwise.

  • default: None

output_folder¶

Path (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute) where output files are saved. It is used to set the DNN_likelihood.output_folder attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

ensemble_name¶

Name of the DNN_likelihood_ensemble object of which the DNN_likelihood object is a member. This input argument is automatically passed by the generating DNN_likelihood_ensemble object. If the DNN_likelihood object is not a member of an ensemble, this input should be None (default). It is used to set the DNN_likelihood.ensemble_name and DNN_likelihood.ensemble_folder attributes.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

input_summary_json_file¶

File name (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute, with or without the .json extensions) of a saved DNN_likelihood object. It is used to set the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

verbose¶

Argument used to set the verbosity mode of the DNN_likelihood.__init__ method and the default verbosity mode of all class methods that accept a verbose argument. See Verbosity mode.

  • type: bool

  • default: True

Attributes¶

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_callbacks_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_callbacks_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_callbacks_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: list

  • list items type: str and/or dict (see model_callbacks_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_compile_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_compile_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_compile_inputs if present, otherwise it is constructed setting the loss to "mse" and the metrics to ["mse","mae","mape","msle"]. If the object is imported from files the attribute is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: dict (see model_compile_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_data_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_data_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_data_inputs otherwise is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute. If the number of validation and test data points are smaller than one, then they are treated as fractions of the corresponding number of training points and are replaced by the absolute numbers. If "scaleX"`, ``"scaleY", and/or "weighted" are not specified than they are set to False.

  • type: dict (see model_data_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_define_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_define_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_define_inputs otherwise is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute. If "act_func_out_layer"`, ``"dropout_rate", and/or "batch_norm" are not specified than they are set to "linear", 0, and False, respectively.

  • type: dict (see model_define_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_optimizer_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_optimizer_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_optimizer_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute. For all arguments of the optimizer that are not specified the default value is used.

  • type: str or dict (see model_optimizer_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__model_train_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_train_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_train_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: dict (see model_train_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__resources_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument resources_inputs. If the input argument is not given, i.e. it is set to the default value None, the dictionary is set by the DNN_likelihood.__set_resources private method.

  • type: dict (see resources_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.act_func_out_layer¶

String representing the activation function in the output layer. It is set from the DNN_likelihood.__model_define_inputs dictionary.

  • type: str

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.active_gpus¶

List specifying the GPUs active in the current environment. For each GPU the list contains two strings with device ID and information, respectively. It is either set from the the DNN_likelihood.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DNN_likelihood.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_active_gpus,2)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.available_cpu¶

List specifying the CPU resources. It contains three strings with device ID, specifications, number of cores, respectively. It is either set from the the DNN_likelihood.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DNN_likelihood.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (3,)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.available_gpus¶

List specifying the GPUs available on the current machine. For each GPU the list contains two strings with device ID and information, respectively. It is either set from the the DNN_likelihood.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DNN_likelihood.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_available_gpus,2)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.batch_norm¶

If True, then batch normalization layers are added after the input layer and between each pair of hidden layers. It is set from the the DNN_likelihood.__model_define_inputs dictionary (False if not specified in the input argument model_define_inputs).

  • type: bool

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.batch_size¶

Specifies the default batch size used for training, evaluation, and prediction. It is set from the DNN_likelihood.__model_train_inputs dictionary.

  • type: int

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.callbacks¶

List of tf.keras.callbacks objects. It is set by the DNN_likelihood.__set_callbacks method by evaluating the corresponding strings in the DNN_likelihood.callbacks_strings attribute.

  • type: list of tf.keras.callbacks objects

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.callbacks_strings¶

List of tf.keras.callbacks strings. It is set by the DNN_likelihood.__set_callbacks method by parsing the content of the DNN_likelihood.__model_callbacks_inputs dictionary.

  • type: list of str

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.data¶

The Data object used by the DNN_likelihood one for data management. It is set to the value of the input ärgument data if passed. Otherwise, the DNN_likelihood.__set_data sets it to a Data object imported from the DNN_likelihood.input_data_file.

  • type: Data object

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_data_file¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument input_data_file. If the latter is not passed, DNN_likelihood.input_data_file is set to DNN_likelihood.data.input_file.

  • type: str

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.dropout_rate¶

Specifies the dropout rate for the Dropout layers. It is set from the DNN_likelihood.__model_define_inputs dictionary. If the value is 0 no Dropout layers are added to the model.

  • type: float

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.dtype¶

Required data type for the generation of the train/validation/test datasets. The attribute is set by the DNN_likelihood.__set_dtype methods to the value of the dtype if it is not None and to "float64" otherwise.

  • type: str

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.ensemble_folder¶

If the DNN_likelihood object is a member of a DNN_likelihood_ensemble object, then this attribute is set to the parent directory of DNN_likelihood.output_folder, where, by default, the DNN_likelihood_ensemble object is stored (and corresponding to the DNN_likelihood_ensemble.ensemble_folder attribute of the DNN_likelihood_ensemble object). The attribute is by the DNN_likelihood.__check_define_ensemble_name_folder method based on the value of the DNN_likelihood.ensemble_name attribute. If the latter is None, then also DNN_likelihood.output_folder attribute is set to None, the DNN_likelihood object is considered “standalone”, and the DNN_likelihood.standalone is set to True.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.ensemble_name¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument ensemble_name. If the DNN_likelihood object is a member of a DNN_likelihood_ensemble object, then the latter automatically passes the input argument ensemble_name when it creates the DNN_likelihood object. The attribute is by the DNN_likelihood.__check_define_ensemble_name_folder method. If the input argument is None, then also the attribute is set to None, the DNN_likelihood object is considered “standalone”, and the DNN_likelihood.standalone is set to True.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.epochs_available¶

Number if epochs for which DNN_likelihood.model has been trained. It is updated by the DNN_likelihood.model_train method after each training.

  • type: int

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.epochs_required¶

Number of epochs required for the training. The first time the object is created it is set to the value of the “epochs” item in the DNN_likelihood.__model_train_inputs dictionary. It can be manually changed before calling the DNN_likelihood.model_train method to train for more epochs. Notice that each call to the DNN_likelihood.model_train method only trains for a number of epochs equal to the difference between DNN_likelihood.epochs_required and DNN_likelihood.epochs_available (set by the private method DNN_likelihood.__set_epochs_to_run).

  • type: int

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.figures_list¶

List of absolute paths to the generated figures.

  • type: list of str

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.generic_pars_labels¶

Copy of the DNN_likelihood.data.generic_pars_labels attribute of the Data object used for data management (see the doc of the Data.generic_pars_labels attribute).

  • type: list

  • shape: [ ]

  • length: n_pars

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.gpu_mode¶

Attribute set by the DNN_likelihood.__set_resources method and indicating whether the object has GPU support (True) or not (False). If the object is a mamber of a DNN_likelihood_ensemble one, then the attribute is set from the DNN_likelihood.__resources_inputs attribute.

  • type: bool

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.hidden_layers¶

Attribute corresponding to the “hidden_layer” item of the DNN_likelihood.__model_define_inputs attribute. It is a list with hidden layers specifications. Each hidden layer is represented by a list with number of nodes (int), activation function (str), and (optionally) initializer (str)

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_hidden_layers,3)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.history¶

Attribute corresponding to the “history” dictionary of the History object returned by the tf.keras.model.fit method. It contains a list with the history of values of metrics for each training epoch. The contento of this dictionary is saved into the file DNN_likelihood.output_history_json_file.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “metric” (value type: list)

      List with values of metric for each epoch. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

    • “lr” (value type: float)

      List with values of the learning rate at each epoch.

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.idx_test¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the test data points in the data arrays contained in DNN_likelihood.data.data_X and DNN_likelihood.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_test” item of the Data.data_dictionary object DNN_likelihood.data.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_test,)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.idx_train¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the training data points in the data arrays contained in DNN_likelihood.data.data_X and DNN_likelihood.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_train” item of the Data.data_dictionary object DNN_likelihood.data.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_train,)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.idx_val¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the validation data points in the data arrays contained in DNN_likelihood.data.data_X and DNN_likelihood.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_val” item of the DNN_likelihood.data.data_dictionary attribute.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_val,)

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name¶

Absolute path with base file name corresponding to the input argument input_summary_json_file without the “_summary” suffix. Whenever this attribute is not None, it is used to set all input file names and to reconstructed the object from input files (see the DNN_likelihood.__init__ method for details).

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_history_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DNN_likelihood.history attribute (see the DNN_likelihood.save_history_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_idx_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing saved data indices (see the DNN_likelihood.save_data_indices method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file containing saved DNN_likelihood method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_predictions_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DNN_likelihood.predictions (see the DNN_likelihood.save_data_indices method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_scalers_pickle_file¶

Absolute path to the .pickle file containing saved data standard scalers (see the DNN_likelihood.save_scalers method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_summary_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DNN_likelihood object (see the DNN_likelihood.save_summary_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.input_tf_model_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing saved tf.keras.Model corresponding to the DNN_likelihood.model (see the DNN_likelihood.save_summary_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DNN_likelihood.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.load_on_RAM¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument load_on_RAM. If True all data available in the HDF5 dataset DNN_likelihood.input_data_file are loaded into the RAM for faster generation of train/validation/test data. If False the HDF5 file is open in read mode and train/validation/test data are generated on demand.

  • type: str or None

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.log¶

Dictionary containing a log of the Data object calls. The dictionary has datetime strings as keys and actions as values. Actions are also dictionaries, containing details of the methods calls.

  • type: dict

  • keys: datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]

  • values: dict with the following structure:

    • “action” (value type: str)

      Short description of the action. possible values: "created", ""loaded summary json"", "loaded history json", "loaded tf model h5", "loaded scalers h5", "loaded data indices h5", "loaded predictions json", "optimizer set", "loss set", "metrics set", "callbacks set", "computed sample weights", "defined scalers", "generated train data", "generated test data", "defined tf model", "compiled tf model", "built tf model", "trained tf model", "predicted with tf model", "computed maximum logpdf", "evaluated tf model", "saved figure", "computed predictions", "saved indices", "saved tf model json", "saved tf model h5", "saved tf model onnx", "saved history json", "saved summary json", "saved predictions json", "saved scalers h5", "saved model graph pdf".

    • “file name” (value type: str)

      File name of file involved in the action.

    • “file path” (value type: str)

      Path of file involved in the action.

    • “files names” (value type: list of str)

      List of file names of files involved in the action.

    • “files paths” (value type: list of str)

      List of paths of files involved in the action.

    • “optimizer” (value type: str)

      String corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.optimizer_string.

    • “loss” (value type: str)

      String corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.loss_string.

    • “metrics” (value type: list of str)

      List corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.metrics_string.

    • “callbacks” (value type: list of str)

      List corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.callbacks_strings.

    • “scaler X” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.scalerX_bool.

    • “scaler Y” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.scalerY_bool.

    • “data” (value type: list of str)

      List of data involved in the action. It could include the strings: “idx_train”, “X_train”, “Y_train”, “idx_val”, “X_val”, “Y_val”, “idx_test”, “X_test”, “Y_test”.

    • “npoints train” (value type: int)

      Number of training points corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.npoints_train.

    • “npoints val” (value type: int)

      Number of validation points corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.npoints_val.

    • “npoints test” (value type: int)

      Number of test points corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.npoints_test.

    • “model summary” (value type: list)

      List rendering a print of the model.summary() method of tf.keras.Model.

    • “gpu mode” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.gpu_mode.

    • “device id” (value type: str)

      String with the ID of the device on which model has been built (see the DNN_likelihood.model_build method).

    • “epochs run” (value type: int)

      Number of epochs of the current training run.

    • “epochs total” (value type: int)

      Total number of training epochs.

    • “batch size” (value type: int)

      Batch size used for action (training, predicting, evaluating), corresponding to the attribute DNN_likelihood.batch_size.

    • “training time” (value type: float)

      Training time in seconds of the last training.

    • “prediction time” (value type: float)

      Prediction time in seconds of the last prediction.

    • “evaluation time” (value type: float)

      Evaluation time in seconds of the last evaluation.

    • “npoints” (value type: int)

      Number of points involved in the corresponding action.

    • “optimizer” (value type: str)

      String representing the optimizer used to maximise the logpdf.

    • “optimization time” (value type: float)

      Time in second for computation of the maximum of logpdf.

    • “probability intervals” (value type: list)

      Probability intervals used for predictions.

    • “pars” (value type: list)

      Parameters involved in predictions.

DNNLikelihood.DNN_likelihood.predictions¶

Nested dictionary containing all predictions generated by the DNN_likelihood.model_compute_predictions method. The contento of this dictionary is saved into the file DNN_likelihood.output_predictions_json_file.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “HPDI” (value type: dict)

      Highest posterior density intervals (HPDI) for the parameters. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “par” (value type: dict)

        Dictionary corresponding to parameter par. This dictionary has the following structure:

        • “pred” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed reweighting distributions using the DNN prediction. Has the same structure as the item “true”.

        • “true” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed using the original data. This dictionary has the following structure:

          • “test” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “train” and “val”.

          • “train” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “test” and “val”.

          • “val” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

            • “Probability” (value type: dict)

              Dictionary with HPDI corresponding to the interval interval. Default intervals for the DNN_likelihood.model_compute_predictions method are "0.5", "0.6826894921370859", "0.9544997361036416", and "0.9973002039367398". The latter three correspond to 1,2,3 standard deviations for a 1D normal distribution (obtained through the inference.CI_from_sigma function). This dictionary has the following structure:

              • “Bin width” (value type: float)

                Width of the binning used to compute the HPDI (see the inference.HPDI function for details). It gives an estimate of the uncertainty due to the algorithm for computing HPDI.

              • “Intervals” (value type: list of list)

                List of intervals of parameter values for the given probability.

              • “Number of bins” (value type: int)

                Number of bins used for the computation of HPDI (see the inference.HPDI function for details).

              • “Probability” (value type: float)

                Probability interval.

    • “HPDI_error” (value type: dict)

      Errors on the HPDI quantified as differences (absolute and relative) between the predictions of HPDI computed with input data and with DNN reweight. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “par” (value type: dict)

        Dictionary corresponding to parameter par. This dictionary has the following structure:

        • “test” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “train” and “val”.

        • “train” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “test” and “val”.

        • “val” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

          • “Probability” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary with HPDI corresponding to the interval interval. Default intervals for the DNN_likelihood.model_compute_predictions method are "0.5", "0.6826894921370859", "0.9544997361036416", and "0.9973002039367398". The latter three correspond to 1,2,3 standard deviations for a 1D normal distribution (obtained through the inference.CI_from_sigma function). This dictionary has the following structure:

            • “Absolute error” (value type: list of list)

              List of absolute errors (computed as true-pred) for each boundary of the intervals (see the inference.HPDI_error function for details)

            • “Probability” (value type: float)

              Probability interval.

            • “Relative error” (value type: list of list)

              List of relative errors (computed as (true-pred)/true) for each boundary of the intervals (see the inference.HPDI_error function for details)

    • “KS” (value type: dict)

      Weighted Kolmogorov-Smirnov test statistics and p-values for two sample distributions for each parameter (see the inference.ks_w function for details). This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “Test vs pred on train” (value type: list, shape: (n_pars,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Test vs pred on val” (value type: list, shape: (n_pars,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on validation data.

      • “Train vs pred on train” (value type: list, shape: (n_pars,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input train data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Val vs pred on test” (value type: list, shape: (n_pars,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input validation data and DNN reweighted prediction on test data.

    • “KS medians” (value type: dict)

      Median over parameters of the KS p-values for two sample distributions. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “Test vs pred on train” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Test vs pred on val” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on validation data.

      • “Train vs pred on train” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input train data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Val vs pred on test” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input validation data and DNN reweighted prediction on test data.

    • “Metrics on scaled data” (value type: dict)

      Value of all metrics (loss and metrics) evaluated on scaled data for train/val/test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on train data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

      • “test_metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on test data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "test_mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

      • “val_metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on validation data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "val_mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

    • “Metrics on unscaled data” (value type: dict)

      Value of all metrics (loss and metrics) evaluated on original data for train/val/test data. This dictionary has the same structure of the previous one with all keys having the suffix “_unscaled”.

    • “Prediction time” (value type: float)

      Averege prediction time per point in second with batch size equal to DNN_likelihood.batch_size.

  • schematic example:

    {'HPDI': {'par_1': {'pred': {'test': {'prob_1': {'Bin width': float,
                                                 'Intervals': list,
                                                 'Number of bins': int,
                                                 'Probability': float
                                                },
                                      ...,
                                      {'prob_n': ...
                                      },
                             'train': ...,
                             'val': ...
                            },
                    'true': ...},
          ...,
          'par_n': ...
         },
 'HPDI_error': {'par_1': {'test': {'prob_1': {'Absolute error': list,
                                              'Probability': float,
                                              'Relative error': list
                                             },
                                   ...,
                                   {'prob_n': ...
                                   },
                          'train': ...,
                          'val': '...
                         },
                ...,
                'par_n': ...
               },
 'KS': {'Test vs pred on train': list,
        'Test vs pred on val': list,
        'Train vs pred on train': list,
        'Val vs pred on test': list},
 'KS medians': {'Test vs pred on train': float,
                'Test vs pred on val': float,
                'Train vs pred on train': float,
                'Val vs pred on test': float},
 'Metrics on scaled data': {'loss_best': float,
                            'mean_absolute_error_best': float,
                            ...
                           },
 'Metrics on unscaled data': {'loss_best_unscaled': float,
                              'mean_absolute_error_best_unscaled': float,
                              ...
                             },
 'Prediction time': float}

DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__set_epochs_to_run(verbose=None)¶

Private method that returns the number of steps to run computed as the difference between the value of Sampler.nsteps_required and the number of steps available in Sampler.backend. If this difference is negative, a warning message asking to increase the value of Sampler.nsteps_required is printed.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

DNN_likelihood._DNN_likelihood__set_pars_labels(pars_labels)¶

Private method that returns the pars_labels choice based on the pars_labels input.

  • Arguments

    • pars_labels

      Could be either one of the keyword strings "original" and "generic" or a list of labels strings with the length of the parameters array. If pars_labels="original" or pars_labels="generic" the function returns the value of Sampler.pars_labels or Sampler.generic_pars_labels, respectively, while if pars_labels is a list, the function just returns the input.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • accepted strings: "original", "generic"
